list_page_teaser: Although they all share a preference for rationality, Howard Colvin's temperament is quite different from the personalities of most of the other higher-ups in the police department on The Wire.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
These images of the personalities of the Mayor and the brass at the upper levels of the police department on The Wire show that cold logic rules the day. These are the images of rational decision-makers who are used to getting their way.

The image of Cedric's personality shows he has a bit more flexibility than most of the others. More significant is Howard Colvin's spiritual portrait, which shows how although his personality is also dominated by logic, he is also open to new — and as viewers learn, even extremely radical — ideas.

image_list.title: Cedric Daniels
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The Green in Cedric Daniels' spiritual portrait shows he is more rational than emotional, and the Yellow shows he is a realist.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Daniels' dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Yellow in Daniels' spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas; need for sensual stimulation.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Daniels' auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Daniels' spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.

image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Rawls' dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Green in Rawls' spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Introverts, the auxiliary trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a vertical line to represent this, because it is more evident than the dominant function.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....

image_list.title: Howard Colvin
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The Green in Howard Colvin's spiritual portrait shows he is logical, and the Blue shows he prefers ideas to facts.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Colvin's dominant personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Colvin's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being logical/rational/objective rather than emotional/personal/subjective.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents Colvin's auxiliary personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.

The Blue in Colvin's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than of facts; need for intellectual stimulation.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
